decision_conditions: The proposed development would be highly visible, prominent and incongruous and would fail to preserve the character and appearance of the Conservation Area and there would be no public benefits to outweigh the identified less than substantial harm, thereby conflicting with Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 (as amended) and Policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Core Strategy 2012 and the NPPF (2023).

The applicant has failed to demonstrate through the submission of cogent information that the proposed development would not result in harm to the health and longevity of trees of amenity value covered by a tree protection order through damage to the Root Protection Areas. The proposal would not accord with Policy G7 of the London Plan 2021 and Policy DM10 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012.
description: Conversion of south side garage into a gym, erection of garage extension to south side . Erection of first floor front and side extension. Roof extension in existing loft space, installation of 2nos rear and 7nos side rooflights with new rear outdoor swimming pool.
